00039 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00040 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00041 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00042    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00043    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept them, but uses a dedicated
00044    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00045 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00046 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00047 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00048 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00052 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00053 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00054 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00055 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00060 struct xnthread;

00062 
00063 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00064 
00065     /* Kernel mode side */
00066     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00067     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00068     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00069     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00070     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00071 
00072     /* User mode side */
00073     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00074     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00075 
00076     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00077     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00078     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00079 
00080 } xnarchtcb_t;
00081 
00082 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00083 
00084     unsigned vector;
00085     long errcode;
00086     struct pt_regs *regs;
00087 
00088 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00089 
00090 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((fi)->vector)
00091 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->errcode)
00092 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->eip)
00093 /* fault is caused by use FPU while FPU disabled. */
00094 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  ((fi)->vector == 7)
00095 /* The following predicates are only usable over a regular Linux stack
00096    context. */
00097 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->vector == 14)
00098 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00099                                  ((fi)->vector == 1 || (fi)->vector == 3))
00100 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi))

00106 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00107 
00108 {
00109     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00110         return vmalloc(bytes);
00111 
00112     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00113 }
00114 
00115 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00116 
00117 {
00118     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00119         vfree(chunk);
00120     else
00121         kfree(chunk);
00122 }

00124 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00125 {
00126     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00127 }

00129 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00130 
00131 {
00132     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00133 }

00148 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00149                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00150 {
00151     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00154 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00155 
00156 {
00157     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00158 
00159     rthal_load_cpuid();
00160 
00161     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00162        and always inside a critical section. */
00163     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00164     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00165     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00166     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00167     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00168 }
00169 
00170 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00171 {
00172     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00173 }
00174 
00175 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00176                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00177                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00178                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00179                                     )
00180 {
00181 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00182 
00183     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00184         "pushfl\n\t" \
00185         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00186         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00187         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00188         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00189         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00190         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00191         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00192         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00193         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00194         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00195         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00196         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00197         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00198         "ret\n\t" \
00199 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00200         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00201         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00202         "popfl\n\t" \
00203       : /* no output */ \
00204       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00205         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00206         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00207         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00208         "b" (out_tcb), \
00209         "S" (in_tcb), \
00210         "a" (outproc), \
00211         "d" (inproc));
00212 
00213 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00214 
00215     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00216     
00217     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00218         "pushfl\n\t" \
00219         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00220         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00221         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00222         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00223         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00224         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00225         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00226         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00227         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00228         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00229         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00230         "ret\n\t" \
00231 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00232         "popfl\n\t" \
00233       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00234         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00235         "=S" (esi_out), \
00236         "=D" (edi_out), \
00237         "+a" (outproc), \
00238         "+d" (inproc) \
00239       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00240         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00241         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00242         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00243 
00244 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00245 }
00246 
00247 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00248                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00249 {
00250     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00251     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00252     unsigned long fs, gs;
00253 
00254     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00255         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00256            clear the ts bit. */
00257         clts();
00258     
00259     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00260 
00261     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00262         {
00263         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00264 
00265         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00266 
00267         if (!inproc->mm)
00268             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00269         }
00270 
00271     if (out_tcb->user_task) {
00272        /* Make sure that __switch_to() will always reload the correct
00273           %fs and %gs registers, even if we happen to migrate the task
00274           across domains in the meantime. */
00275         asm volatile("mov %%fs,%0":"=m" (fs));
00276         asm volatile("mov %%gs,%0":"=m" (gs));
00277     }
00278 
00279     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00280 
00281     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00282 
00283         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00284 
00285         loadsegment(fs, fs);
00286         loadsegment(gs, gs);
00287 
00288         barrier();
00289 
00290         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00291            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00292            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00293            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00294            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00295            raw I/O ops. */
00296 
00297         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00298             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, rthal_processor_id());
00299 
00300             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00301                 
00302                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00303 
00304                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00305                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00306                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00307                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00308 
00309                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00310                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00311             }
00312         }
00313     }
00314 
00315     stts();
00316 }
00317 
00318 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00319                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00320 {
00321     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00322 }
00323 
00324 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00325 {
00326     /* Empty */
00327 }
00328 
00329 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00330                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00331                                          const char *name)
00332 {
00333     tcb->user_task = current;
00334     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00335     tcb->esp = 0;
00336     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00337     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00338     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00339 }
00340 
00341 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00342                                                int imask,
00343                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00344                                                void *cookie)
00345 {
00346     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00347     stts();
00348     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00349     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00350     entry(cookie);
00351     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00352 }
00353 
00354 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00355                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00356                                        void *cookie,
00357                                        int imask,
00358                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00359                                        char *name)
00360 {
00361     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00362 
00363     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00364     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00365     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00366     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00367     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00368     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00369     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00370     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00371     *--(*psp) = 0;
00372 }
00373 
00374 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00375 
00376 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00377 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   ((task)->used_math)
00378 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) ((task)->used_math = 1)
00379 #else
00380 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   tsk_used_math(task)
00381 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) set_stopped_child_used_math(task)
00382 #endif
00383 
00384 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00385 
00386 {
00387     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00388     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00389        task. */
00390 
00391     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00392 
00393     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00394         {
00395         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00396         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00397         }
00398 
00399     if(task)
00400         {
00401         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: tell Linux that this thread
00402           initialized its FPU hardware. The TS_USEDFPU bit is necessary for
00403           xnarch_save_fpu to save the FPU state at next switch. */
00404         xnarch_set_fpu_init(task);
00405         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00406         }   
00407 }
00408 
00409 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00410 
00411 {
00412     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00413     
00414     if(task)
00415         {
00416         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00417             return;
00418 
00419         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00420            of this task. */
00421         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00422         }
00423 
00424     clts();
00425     
00426     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00427         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00428     else
00429         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00430 }
00431 
00432 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00433 
00434 {
00435     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00436 
00437     if (task)
00438         {
00439         if (!xnarch_fpu_init_p(task))
00440             {
00441             stts();
00442             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00443             }
00444 
00445         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00446            hardware. */
00447         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00448         }
00449 
00450     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00451        user-space or kernel thread. */
00452     clts();
00453 
00454     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00455         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00456     else
00457         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00458 }
00459 
00460 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00461 
00462 {
00463     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00464 
00465     if (task && !(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00466         return;
00467 
00468     clts();
00469 
00470     if (!cpu_has_fxsr && task)
00471         /* fnsave, called by switch_to, initialized the FPU state, so that on
00472            cpus prior to PII (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved
00473            state. */
00474         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00475 }
00476 
00477 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00478 
00479 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00480 
00481 {}
00482 
00483 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00484 
00485 {}
00486 
00487 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00488 
00489 {}
00490 
00491 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00492 
00493 {}
00494 
00495 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00496 
00497 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00499 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00500 
00501 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00502 {
00503     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00504     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00505     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00506     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00507     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00508     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00509 }
00510 
00511 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00512 
00513 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00514 
00515 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00516                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00517                                            const char *name)
00518 {
00519     struct task_struct *task = current;
00520 
00521     tcb->user_task = task;
00522     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00523     tcb->esp = 0;
00524     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00525     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00526     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00527 }
00528 
00529 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00530 
00531 {
00532     unsigned irq;
00533 
00534     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00535         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00536                              irq,
00537                              handler,
00538                              NULL,
00539                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00540 }
00541 
00542 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00543 
00544 {
00545     unsigned irq;
00546 
00547     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00548         {
00549         switch (irq)
00550             {
00551 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00552             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00553             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00554             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00555             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00556 
00557                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00558                 continue;
00559 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00560 
00561             default:
00562 
00563                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00564             }
00565         }
00566 }
00567 
00568 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00569 
00570 {
00571     unsigned irq;
00572 
00573     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00574         {
00575         switch (irq)
00576             {
00577 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00578             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00579             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00580             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00581             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00582 
00583                 continue;
00584 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00585 
00586             default:
00587 
00588                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00589             }
00590         }
00591 }
00592 
00593 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00594 
00595 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00596 
00597 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay)
00598 {
00599     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00600        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00601        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00602        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00603     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00604 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_NMI_DEBUG_LATENCY
00605     extern unsigned long rthal_maxlat_tsc;
00606     if (delay <= (ULONG_MAX - rthal_maxlat_tsc))
00607         rthal_nmi_arm(delay + rthal_maxlat_tsc);
00608 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_NMI_DEBUG_LATENCY */
00609 }
00610 
00611 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void)
00612 {
00613     rthal_timer_release();
00614 }
00615 
00616 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00617 {
00618 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00619     return rthal_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00620 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00621     return 0;
00622 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00623 }
00624 
00625 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00626 
00627 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00628 
00629 #include <linux/init.h>
00630 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00631 
00632 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00633 
00634 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00635 
00636 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00637 
00638 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00639 
00640 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00641 
00642 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00643 
00644 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00645 {
00646     struct pt_regs *regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00647     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00648 
00649     fltinfo.vector = event;
00650     fltinfo.errcode = regs->orig_eax;
00651     fltinfo.regs = regs;
00652 
00653     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00654 }
00655 
00656 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00657 
00658 {
00659 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00660     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00661 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00662     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00663        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00664        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00665        configuration Xenomai is compiled against,
00666        CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00667        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00668     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00669 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00670 }
00671 
00672 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00673 
00674 {
00675     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00676 
00677     if (!nktimerlat)
00678         return -ENODEV;
00679 
00680     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00681 
00682     return 0;
00683 }
00684 
00685 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00686 
00687 {
00688     int err;
00689 
00690 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00691     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00692        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00693     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00694 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00695 
00696     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00697 
00698     if (err)
00699         return err;
00700 
00701     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00702 
00703     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00704         return -ENOSYS;
00705 
00706     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00707                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00708                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00709                          NULL,
00710                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00711 
00712     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00713 
00714 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00715     err = xnshadow_mount();
00716 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00717 
00718     if (err)
00719         {
00720         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00721         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00722         }
00723 
00724     return err;
00725 }
00726 
00727 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00728 
00729 {
00730 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00731     xnshadow_cleanup();
00732 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00733     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00734     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00735 }
00736 
00737 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00738 
00739 #ifdef __cplusplus
00740 }
00741 #endif
00742 
00743 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00744 
00745 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00746 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
00747 
00748 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00749 
00750 #endif /* !_XENO_ASM_I386_SYSTEM_H */
